description.narrative: The development objectives of UDP 3 phase II are: (a) to improve the provision of infrastructure and services in Conakry and secondary cities; and (b) to improve the fnancial and organizational management of municipalities in support of the decentralization process.

condition.narrative: Deposit into account, no later than the dates specified in the Municipal Contracts, the amounts specified in said Contractsrequired to finance its contribution for expenditures under the Project.....
Recipient to appoint an Environmental Focal Point in each of the following entities: (i) Primary Roads Unit; (ii) Secondary RoadsUnit; (iii) Public Solid Waste Transfer Unit; (iv) Technical Munic....

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to regular solid waste collection under the project

comment.narrative: 1,440,000 persons having access correspond to 72% of total population. Indicator previously added to ISR. Will be used forrestructured project

title.narrative: Fiscal revenues collected during project lifetime (Comp 3)
Tax rolls issued during project lifetime (increase) (Comp 3)
TPU and Patente in secondary cities
Tax rolls issued during project lifetime (increase) for Conakry.
Tax rolls issued during project lifetime (increase) for Secondary cities.
TPU, CFU and Patente in Conakry
Population of cities (Conakry) getting access to services (solid waste management)

comment.narrative: Indicator revised during mission to give the above one.

title.narrative: Local governments having established effective management systems to operate commercial infrastructure.

comment.narrative: New indicator introduced only with project restructuring.
In late May 2013 concerned city councils decided on types of management systems but no system so far put in place for actualoperation.

title.narrative: Local governments generating budget reports on time.

comment.narrative: New indicator introduced only with project restructuring.
Local governments staff trained over April to May 2013 and budget reports expected still to be generated.

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: New indicator with project restructuring to take into account the relatively high number of improved water sources expected underthe project (in schools).
Two water points still be constructed in two schools. The deadline set for their completion is June 20, 2013.

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the project

comment.narrative: New indicator with project restructuring to take into account the relatively high number of people to benefit from improved watersources under the project (in schools).
The end-of-project target likely to be achieved once construction of remainder of water points will be completed.

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Sanitation under the project

comment.narrative: New indicator with project restructuring to take into account the relatively high number of people to benefit from publicsanitation under the project (in schools).
This data relate to the number of pupils provided with access to sanitation through the latrines built in ten schools under theproject. Latrines for one school still to be completed.

title.narrative: Number of priority maintenance programs elaborated and implemented (Comp2)

comment.narrative: Maintenance programs have been elaborated and are being implemented in five cities for 2013.

title.narrative: Number of priority maintenance programs elaborated and implemented (Comp 1).

comment.narrative: The maintenance programs for 2013 have been elaborated. Their implementation is underway.

title.narrative: Market places created or improved under the project (Comp2)

comment.narrative: Works for markets rehabilitation in advanced stage but so far not fully completed and accepted.
Works for parking stands in advanced stage but so far not fully completed / accepted.

title.narrative: Budgets allocated and spent on routine maintenance (Comp 2)

comment.narrative: Target for 3% spent on routine maintenance is GNF 1,039,573,800 (base 2004)
Target as percentage of budget (3%) maintained for restructured project, baseline and methodology updated.
Data for budgets allocated in 2013 but no evidence on implementation. Data confirmed for 2012 are 4.9% budget allocated and 4.7%budget actually spent on routine maintenance in secondary cities.

title.narrative: Budgets allocated and spent on routine maintenance (Comp 1)

comment.narrative: Target for 3% spent on routine maintenance is GNF 4,954,214,000 (base 2004)
Target as percentage of budget (3%) maintained for restructured project, but baseline and methodology updated.
Data calculated based on four months management practice (Jan-Apr) in 2013.
The breakdown of this indicator in reflected below

title.narrative: Solid waste collected by SMEs compared to total waste produced (Comp 1)
Solid waste transferred by the SPTD to La Miniere landfill compared to total waste produced (Comp 1)
Municipalities of Conakry with improved fiscal registers in place and in use (Comp 3)

comment.narrative: Target was revised with project restructuring. It is expected to be achieved.
Activities underway to put in place improved fiscal registers in the three communes of Kaloum, Dixinn and Matam. Their completionexpected by project closing.
Include also beneficiaries from other infrastructure services not separately accounted for in the results framework.
So far only accounted for beneficiaries of roads rehabilitated under both parent project and AF in Conakry, and school latrinesandwater points put in place in secondary cities.
Works completed for additional 1.70 km of roads.

title.narrative: Municipalities with street addressing in place and operational (Comp 3)

comment.narrative: Target was revised with project restructuring. It is expected to be achieved.
Works underway to update street addressing in the three communes of Kaloum, Dixinn and Matam. Their completion expected by projectclosing.

title.narrative: Investments built/rehabilitated/maintained to benefit poor neighborhoods of targeted secondary cities (Comp 2)

comment.narrative: Target revised with project restructuring. All the other investments are under implementation but the two which were canceled inDecember 2012.
All outputs refer to schools rehabilitated.

title.narrative: Length of drains cleaned and neighborhood roads rehabilitated (Comp4)

comment.narrative: Out of the total length of network serviced, about 8 km of neighborhood roads have been rehabilitated hence providing access toall-year to additional people accounted for in PDO outcomes.

Over time cleaning of drains had been prioritized to stress of the need for improved environment in concerned neighborhoods. Thisalso provided room for increased lengths in outputs within same envelops.

title.narrative: Temporary jobs created for a period of 2-3 months (Comp4)

comment.narrative: Sharp increases in fuel prices over years resulted in reduction of relative share of temporary jobs created for worksimplementation.

title.narrative: Wages distributed to workers (Amount in Billion GNF, not in US$) - (Comp4)

comment.narrative: Sharp increases in fuel prices over years resulted in reduction of relative share of wages in total value of works completed.

title.narrative: Number of people in urban areas provided with access to all-season roads within a 500 meter range under the project

comment.narrative: Target set following project restructuring in December 2011.
Additional 1.7 km of roads rehabilitated and benefiting 19,000 additional people.
